column4: quesiton, im updating dapper just basic updates but it says theres new packages to be installed and they are : The following NEW packages will be installed:
linux-image-2.6.15-27-386 linux-restricted-modules-2.6.15-27-386 is that normal that they would be kept back until you do a dist-upgrade?
linux-image-2.6.15-27-386 linux-restricted-modules-2.6.15-27-386 is that normal that they would be kept back until you do a dist-upgrade?
quesiton, im updating dapper just basic updates but it says theres new packages to be installed and they are : The following NEW packages will be installed:
linux-image-2.6.15-27-386 linux-restricted-modules-2.6.15-27-386 is that normal that they would be kept back until you do a dist-upgrade?
yes, that could well be normal
Well im wondering if updating will fix it
i dont wanna break my system
my rule is, don't upgrade just because an upgrade is available.  upgrade because you need to for some reason.
would it break something to upgrade just a single app?
ordinarily, no.  if you use synaptic, you'll see what will be updated due to dependencies before you pull the switch
